<!--Trinity and All Saints College: University of Leeds College. Offering Undergraduate degrees in

<meta name="description" content="Welcome to Trinity and All Saints College. We are a college of the University of Leeds that offers both Undergraduate and Postgraduate degrees. Specialisms include Education & Media Studies.">

<div align="center"><font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="1"><a href="index.htm">About
TAS Promotional Video | Interactive
Campus Map| How to get here
Calendar
and All Saints is an independent Catholic foundation committed
to the principles of care and community, and welcoming
female and male students of all religions, ethnic backgrounds
and cultures. It has been offering degrees of the University
of Leeds since 1974 and was designated a 'College of the
University of Leeds' in 1991. The College offers a full
programme of undergraduate and postgraduate courses, continuing
professional education and specialist training and consultancy
The College welcomes students from all parts of the United
Kingdom and overseas. As a Catholic foundation, the College
has a particular responsibility to contribute to the provision
of higher education for Catholics. Of course, admission
is not restricted to Catholics. The College welcomes suitably
qualified applicants who share or sympathise with Christian
values, or for whom it can meet a particular need, especially
from those social groups which have hitherto benefited
Trinity and All Saints (TAS) aims to provide high quality
education for all its students in an environment which
This Charter defines the standards of provision which
students can reasonably anticipate and the responsibilities
which students are expected to assume as members of the
College. While the College will strive to achieve the
standards stipulated in this Charter, they must be understood
as expressions of intent, in good faith. They are not
legally binding. The same principle applies to the College's
All students have rights, privileges and obligations.
They arise from the partnership they enter into with the
College. This Charter both articulates the key components
of that relationship and serves as the point of reference
by which adherence to or breach of its spirit and content
will be judged. <b>Students should, therefore, study it
carefully and become familiar with its provisions.
undertakes, so far as lies within its powers, to:
1. Publish clear and accurate information about the College
and its facilities, programmes of study, entrance requirements
2. Process all applications efficiently and fairly, providing
individual guidance where it reasonably can.
3. Provide a congenial, safe and supportive learning environment.
5. Operate accessible and efficient complaints and academic
of the TAS student community are expected to:
1. Behave responsibly at all times, respecting other students,
staff, local residences and TAS property.
2. Acquaint themselves and comply with College regulations.
3. Fulfil the academic requirements of their programmes of
study and co-operate with members of staff.
4. Ensure that all fees are paid on time
5. Seek advice from the appropriate tutor or support service
if they are experiencing academic or other problems.
6. Help foster the community life of the College.
